headerEntries: Fierna's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 25}, {@hit 17} to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede Fierna's darkvision.

trait.name: Flames of Phlegethos
entries: Fierna is covered in dark flames. At the start of his turn, any creature within 5 feet of her takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage, if Fierna desires it.

trait.name: Hellfire Mastery
entries: When Fierna inflicts fire damage from a Hellfire ability on any opponent that fire damage ignores the target's fire resistance and immunity. Fierna is immune to damage from her own hellfire abilities.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Fierna fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Fierna has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Fierna regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn. If she takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of her next turn. Fierna dies only if she starts her turn with 0 hit points and is unable to regenerate.

trait.name: Fiery Weapons
entries: Fiernas weapon attacks are magical. When she hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra ({@dice 4d8}) fire damage on a hit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Fierna uses hes Hellfire Lash ability (if available) and then makes two attacks with her Hellfire Sword.

action.name: Hellfire Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d10 + 9}) piercing damage. At Fierna's whim, a successful hit does an additional 27 ({@damage 6d8}) fire or cold damage.

action.name: Ashen Teleport
entries: Fierna's body and any equipment he is wearing or carrying turns to ash and he magically teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see and reforms.

action.name: Hellfire Lash {@recharge 5}
entries: Fierna unleashes a 60-foot long lash of hellfire that ignites a 5-foot radius around where it strikes. Any targets in the area of effect must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity check or take 22 ({@damage 5d8}) fire damage. The damage is halved on a successful saving throw.

action.name: Summon Allies (1/Day)
entries: Fierna summons {@dice 1d4} {@creature ice devil||ice devils}.

legendary.name: Hellfire Storm (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Fierna selects an area up to 160 feet away from him and creates a hellfire explosion in a 20-foot radius. Anyone in the area that fails the {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw takes 38 ({@damage 7d10}) fire damage. Those that succeed suffer only half the damage.

legendary.name: Hellfire Wings
entries: Fierna uses his wings to generate a burst of heat. Each creature within 10 feet of him must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. They also must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or suffer 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: Fierna uses his Ashen Teleport action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Tigorrila makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}37 ({@damage 7d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the Tigorrila moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the Tigorrila can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

bonus.name: Reckless Rage {@recharge 5}
entries: As a bonus action the Tigorrila give in to its primal fury. The Tigorrila gains advantage on attacks that uses strength until the end of its turn, but all attacks are made with advantage against it until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Tigorrila makes a Claw and a Bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the Tigorrila moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the Tigorrila can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

bonus.name: Reckless Rage {@recharge 6}
entries: As a bonus action the Tigorrila give in to its primal fury. The Tigorrila gains advantage on attacks that uses strength until the end of its turn, but all attacks are made with advantage against it until the start of its next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Mqoro is an 20th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). Mqoro has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Preparation
entries: When preparing his spells, Mqoro can swap out any spell on his  list of prepared spells for another wizard spell of the same level.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Mqoro fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Life Drain
entries: When Mqoro reduces a creature to 0 hit points that is neither a construct nor undead with a spell of 1st level or higher, Mqoro gains temporary hit points equal to 5 times the spells level.

trait.name: Master of Undeath
entries: Undeads created Mqoro obey his commands until they are destroyed or {@condition charmed} by another creature.
Additionally as an action he can take control over an undead. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} saving throw, if the targets Intelligence is 8 or higher it makes the save with advantage.

trait.name: Shadow Flames
entries: Whenever Mqoro casts a spell that causes fire damage it can instead change the damage type to necrotic.

action.name: Withering Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 7d6}) necrotic damage and the target can't regain hit points until the start of Mqoro's next turn.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: Mqoro casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Withering Touch (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Mqoro uses his Paralyzing Touch.

legendary.name: Disrupt Life (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Each non-undead creature within 20 feet of Mqoro must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Cast Minor Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Mqoro casts a spell of 3rd level or lower.

legendary.name: Cast Major Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Mqoro casts a spell.

monster.name: Mqoro's Faithful Hound
languages: understands the same languages his master knows but can't speak it

trait.name: Thousand Eyes
entries: The hound has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.
Additionally it can see {@condition invisible} creatures and objects, as well as see into the Ethereal Plane, out to a range of 120 feet.

trait.name: Necrotic Absorption
entries: Whenever the hound is subjected to necrotic damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hound can make two melee attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Shadow Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The hound exhales a dark fog in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage and is {@condition blinded} for one minute. On successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition blinded}.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The nakika can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nakika makes three tentacle attacks, each of which it can replace with a use of Fling or Pressurized Jet (if available).

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The octopus has eight tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Fling
entries: One Medium or smaller object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the octopus is thrown up to 40 feet in a choosen direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Pressurized Jet {@recharge 5}
entries: The octopus shoots pressurized water jet at a target it can see within 120 feet. The target must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 5d10}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Tentacle Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The octopus makes one tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Fling
entries: The kraken uses Fling.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries: The owlbear has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight or smell.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the owlbear moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with an attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the owlbear takes 27 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The owlbear makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) slashing damage or 39 ({@damage 6d10 + 6}) slashing damage if the target is pinned down.

An owlbear's screech echoes through dark valleys and benighted forests, piercing the quiet night to announce the death of its prey. Feathers cover the thick, shaggy coat of its bearlike body, and the limpid pupils of its great round eyes stare furiously from its owlish head.

entries.name: Deadly Ferocity
entries: The owlbear's reputation for ferocity, aggression, stubbornness, and sheer ill temper makes it one of the most feared predators of the wild. There is little, if anything, that a hungry owlbear fears. Even monsters that outmatch an owlbear in size and strength avoid tangling with it, for this creature cares nothing about a foe's superior strength as it attacks without provocation.

entries.name: Consummate Predators
entries: An owlbear emerges from its den around sunset and hunts into the darkest hours of the night, hooting or screeching to declare its territory, to search for a mate, or to flush prey into its hunting grounds. These are typically forests familiar to the owlbear, and dense enough to limit its quarry's escape routes.

An owlbear makes its den in a cave or ruin littered with the bones of its prey. It drags partially devoured kills back to its den, storing portions of the carcass among the surrounding rocks, bushes, and trees. The scent of blood and rotting flesh hangs heavy near an owlbear's lair, attracting scavengers and thus luring more prey.

Owlbears hunt alone or in mated pairs. If quarry is plentiful, a family of owlbears might remain together for longer than is required to rear offspring. Otherwise, they part ways as soon as the young are ready to hunt.

entries.name: Savage Companions
entries: Although they are more intelligent than most animals, owlbears are difficult to tame. However, with enough time, food, and luck, an intelligent creature can train an owlbear to recognize it as a master, making it an unflinching guard or a fast and hardy mount. People of remote frontier settlements have even succeeded at racing owlbears, but spectators bet as often on which owlbear will attack its handler as they do on which will reach the finish line first.

Elven communities encourage owlbears to den beneath their treetop villages, using the beasts as a natural defense during the night. Hobgoblins favor owlbears as war beasts, and hill giants and frost giants sometimes keep owlbears as pets. A starved owlbear might show up in a gladiatorial arena, ruthlessly eviscerating and devouring its foes before a bloodthirsty audience.

entries.name: Owlbear Origins
entries: Scholars have long debated the origins of the owlbear. The most common theory is that a demented wizard created the first specimen by crossing a giant owl with a bear. However, venerable elves claim to have known these creatures for thousands of years, and some fey insist that owlbears have always existed in the Feywild.

bonus.name: Pin Down
entries: As a bonus action the owlbear can step on a large or smaller creature that is within 5 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the owlbear moves, a creature that is immune to being {@condition grappled} always succeed. The target can use its action to make a Strength check of same DC to try to break free.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Elluin is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). Elluin has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Divine Eminence
entries: As a bonus action, Elluin can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage to a target on a hit. This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If Elluin expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 1st.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The archdruid is an 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The Oakbear magically polymorphs into a beast, monstrosity or elemental with a challenge rating of 6 or less, and can remain in this form for up to 9 hours. The Oakbear can choose whether its equipment falls to the ground, melds with its new form, or is worn by the new form. The Oakbear reverts to its true form if it dies or falls {@condition unconscious}. The Oakbear can revert to its true form using a bonus action on its turn.

While in a new form, the Oakbear retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, and Dexterity are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any special senses, proficiencies, traits, actions, and reactions (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks. It can cast its spells with verbal or somatic components in its new form.
The new form's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunity to nonmagical attacks.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The Oakbear makes an attacks or use one of its special action, depending on its form.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (2 actions)
entries: The Oakbear casts a spell.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Oakbear moves up to its speed.

trait.name: Guardian of Nature
entries: The Oakbear is always under the effect of the {@spell guardian of nature|XGE} and {@spell barkskin} spells.
Additionally he can change between the to Primal Beast and Great Tree forms at the start of your turn (no action required).

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The oakbear can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The beardog has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The beardog makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}) if the target is a large or smaller creature it is also {@condition restrained}. Until this grapple ends the beardog can't bite another target.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The grieving blade's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Shadow Step
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the grieving blade can teleport as a bonus action up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the grieving blade is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to only take half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The grieving blade makes two attacks with its shadow blade or daggers. If either attack hits and the target is within 10 feet of a 5-foot cube of darkness created by the shadow blade, the grieving blade can dismiss that darkness and cause the target to take ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage. The grieving blade can dismiss darkness in this way no more than once per turn.

action.name: Shadow Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage. The grieving blade can then fill an unoccupied 5-foot cube within 5 feet of the target with magical darkness, which remains for 1 minute.

action.name: Shadow Dagger
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h} 7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage. The grieving blade can then fill an unoccupied 5-foot cube within 5 feet of the target with magical darkness, which remains for 1 minute.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: Whenever the grieving blade is hit by an attack he can use its reaction to halve the damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The catoblepas has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature other than a catoblepas that starts its turn within 10 feet of the catoblepas must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of any catoblepas for 1 hour.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 5d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the start of the catoblepas's next turn.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 6d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Death Ray {@recharge 5}
entries: The catoblepas targets a creature that it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target instead takes 64 necrotic damage. The target dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this ray.

The catoblepas is as loathsome as the vile swamplands in which it lives. Like such wastelands, this conglomeration of bloated buffalo, dinosaur, warthog, and hippopotamus parts has few redeeming qualities. Few travelers willingly traverse the territory of a catoblepas.

entries.name: Animalistic Nature
entries: Despite their ungainly physiology, catoblepases resemble natural beasts. A catoblepas behaves much like an animal, too, ambling through its marshy home, munching choice vegetation, eating the occasional bit of carrion, and wallowing in mire. A catoblepas might be found with the one mate it chooses for life and, on occasion, a calf. Especially if it's guarding its young, a catoblepas attacks anyone that moves too close.

Sages say that gods of pestilence and rot created catoblepases as embodiments of their influence. Whatever the origin of the creature, stories link the catoblepas to misfortune, and many of these yarns have elements of truth. Some such tales claim that hags tend catoblepases like cattle, and that a swamp that contains a catoblepas might also be home to a hag that drinks the monster's milk. Although a particular catoblepas might not be linked to a hag, a coven of hags might keep one or more of these beasts as guardians or pets. Other legends say that those of impure heart can tame a catoblepas. Indeed, some tales have circulated of malevolent warlocks and dark knights who have discovered how to domesticate the beasts and use them as mounts.

entries.name: Stench of Death
entries: A catoblepas's stink, like that of death mixed with swamp gas and skunk musk, gives it away as being much more ghastly than its appearance suggests. When it is on the attack, a catoblepas reveals the extent of its horrific nature. The creature's serpentine neck has trouble lifting its head, but one glare from its bloodshot eyes can rot flesh. At the end of its tail is a club that can rattle body and soul if it strikes true, leaving a victim unable to act. If the target of its attacks dies, the catoblepas feasts on the fresh remains.

entries.name: Blighted Territory
entries: A catoblepas's nature as a creature of disease and decay brings out similar characteristics in the creature's swampy habitat. Such a wetland becomes gloomy, tangled, and more fetid than it was before. Beneficial qualities of the environment, such as healing herbs and clean water, diminish when a catoblepas lives nearby. Swamp gases have a hint of the catoblepas's foulness to them. Animals in the area are more aggressive and liable to be diseased. Degenerate creatures are likely to take up residence near a catoblepas's territory, as are those seeking to avoid notice.

entries.name: Sinister Folklore
entries: Ordinary folk rarely see a catoblepas, but the creature has such a feared reputation that stories about it are ingrained in the popular culture. Any rumor of a catoblepas taking up residence nearby is taken to be a bad omen, even if the rumor is proven false. The silhouette of a catoblepas, with its tail extended over its body and its head held low, is a baleful heraldic figure signifying death or doom.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The abjurer is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The abjurer has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d6 - 1}) bludgeoning damage, or 3 ({@damage 1d8 - 1}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Force Blast
entries: Each creature in a 20-foot cube originating from the abjurer must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) force damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from the abjurer. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

reaction.name: Arcane Ward
entries: When the abjurer or a creature it can see within 30 feet of it takes damage, the abjurer magically creates a protective barrier around itself or the other creature. The barrier reduces the damage to the protected creature by 26 ({@damage 4d10 + 4}), to a minimum of 0, and then vanishes.

bonus.name: Scintillating Colors
entries: As an action the abjurer activates its robes to emit dazzling light until the end of its next turn. During this time, the robe sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Creatures that can see the abjurer have disadvantage on attack rolls against him.

Additionally, any creature in the bright light that can see the abjurer when the robes are activated must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated} until the effect ends.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the berserker hits with it.

trait.name: Relentless
entries: If the berserker takes 21 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The berserker deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The berserker makes two melee attacks

action.name: Slam / Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning/slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Supernatural Strength{@recharge 5}
entries: The berseker makes devastating slam attack against a target if it hits the target takes 31 ({@damage 7d8}) extra damage. If the target is a creature it is flung up to 30 feet away from the berserker.

reaction.name: Survival Instinct
entries: Right after the berserker uses its relentless feature it can make a melee attack against a creature within range.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the stalker can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: On the first round of each combat, the stalker has advantage on attack rolls against a creature that hasn't taken a turn yet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The stalker makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage. If the attack roll has advantage, the target also takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Flurry of Claws {@recharge 4}
entries: The stalker makes six claw attacks against one target. Either before or after these attacks, it can move up to its speed as a bonus action without provoking opportunity attacks.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The shaman is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The shaman has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shaman makes two claw attacks, or four claw attacks if it has fewer than half of its hit points remaining.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Coward's retreat
entries: As a bonus action, the shaman can move up to its speed toward an ally that it can see.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the monk is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the monk instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Stand Your Ground
entries: When the monk takes the dodge action it doesn't impose disadvantage to attacks made against him. Instead the monk can use its deflecting palm once per turn without using its reaction.

trait.name: Martial Arts
entries: The monk can use its bonus action dash, disengage, dodge.
Additionally after it takes the attack action he can use its bonus action to make two unarmed strikes or sun bolts.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The monk sheds bright light in a 5- to 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The monk can alter the radius as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The monk makes three attacks. If the monk hits the same target more than once on a turn each attack after the first deals ({@damage 1d8}) extra damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if it hits the same target more than once on a turn.

action.name: Sun Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) radiant damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage if it hits the same target more than once on a turn.

action.name: Sunburst {@recharge 5}
entries: The monk creates a orb of light and hurls it at a point within 150 feet, the orb then burst into a 20-foot-radius sphere of radiant light. Each creature within that area must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 8d6}) radiant damage and can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

reaction.name: Deflecting Palm
entries: When a creature hits the monk with a melee attack, the monk can reduce the damage taken by 27 ({@damage 4d10+5}). If the damage is reduced to 0, the attacker suffers damage equal to what the attack would have dealt.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Flying Kick
entries: If the monk moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with an unarmed strike on the same turn, the target takes an extra 13 ({@dice 3d8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Martial Arts
entries: The monk can use its bonus action dash, disengage, dodge.
Additionally after it takes the attack action he can use its bonus action to make two unarmed strikes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The monk makes three Unarmed Strike attacks, it can substitute one of its Unarmed Strikes for a Jiraishin or a Crushing Palm.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet directly away from the monk.

action.name: Crushing Palm
entries: The monk focus its ki into projecting massive pressure, pushing a {@condition prone} creature within 5 ft against the ground. The target must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw. The target takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Jiraishin (once per turn)
entries: The monk strikes the ground causing tremors, each creature within 10 feet of him must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Deflect Missile
entries: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, the monk deflects the missile. The damage it takes from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10 + 18}. If the damage is reduced to 0, the monk catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and the monk has a hand free.

Martial arts adepts are disciplined monks with extensive training in hand-to-hand combat. Some protect monasteries; others travel the world seeking enlightenment or new forms of combat to master. A few become bodyguards, trading their combat prowess and loyalty for food and lodging.

Some martial artists adorn themselves with tattoos to honor inspirations or instructors, or to memorialize profound lessons, triumphs, or defeats. You may roll on the Martial Arts Adept Tattoos table to determine what sort of tattoo an adept bears.

entries.caption: Martial Arts Adept Tattoos
rows: Patterning on the arms that make them look as though they were made of marble or granite
Collage of playful Elemental or Fey creatures
Constellations on the palm of each hand
Two couatls swirling around each other, rendered in metallic ink

bonus.name: Crippling Blow
entries: When the monk hits a creature with its unarmed strike he can use its bonus action to cripple the target. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or suffer one of the following effects.
{@b Leg Kick:} The target speed is halved. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target's speed is reduced to 0.
{@b Disarm:} The target drops an object its holding and can't use one of its arms until the end of its next turn. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target can't use either of its arms.

bonus.name: Flowing Wind
entries: The monk assumes the flowing wind posture, until the start of its next turn all of his unarmed strikes have a reach of 15 feet. This reach cannot be used to grapple a creature.

monster.name: Kriv

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The deathlock's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The deathlock is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The deathlock has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Deathly Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) necrotic damage).

action.name: Grave Bolts
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120 ft., one or two targets. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained} as shadowy tendrils wrap around it for 1 minute. A {@condition restrained} target can use its action to repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

variant.name: Patron-Specific Spells
entries: You can customize a deathlock by replacing some or all of the spells in its Spellcasting trait with spells specific to its patron. Here are examples.

items: Archfey patron: {@spell blink}, {@spell dominate beast}, {@spell dominate person}, {@spell faerie fire}, {@spell greater invisibility}, {@spell hunger of Hadar}, {@spell hypnotic pattern}, {@spell phantasmal force}, {@spell seeming}, {@spell sleep}

Fiend patron: {@spell blindness/deafness}, {@spell burning hands}, {@spell command}, {@spell fire shield}, {@spell fireball}, {@spell flame strike}, {@spell hellish rebuke}, {@spell scorching ray}, {@spell stinking cloud}, {@spell wall of fire}

Great Old One patron: {@spell clairvoyance}, {@spell detect thoughts}, {@spell dissonant whispers}, {@spell dominate person}, {@spell Evard's black tentacles}, {@spell hunger of Hadar}, {@spell phantasmal force}, {@spell sending}, {@spell Tasha's hideous laughter}, {@spell telekinesis}

items.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The deathlock is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

items.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The deathlock is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

items.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The deathlock is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Elemental Aura
entries: At the start of each of the skeleton's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the skeleton remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a pile of skeleton bones.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
entries: For every 5 feet the skeleton moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skeleton makes three attacks: one with its beak and two with its claws.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage + 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The skeleton releases a breath of fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 7d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Reassemble Bones
entries: As a bonus action, the skeleton can rearrange its bone structure to fit into a space as narrow as 1 foot wide without squeezing. It can use a bonus action to reassemble itself into its normal form. While in this compressed form, it can't make melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Tongue Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 30 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}) and the crocanura  can drag or carry the target while grappling it without any movement penalty. Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the crocanura can't constrict another target.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The crocanura makes one tongue lash attack against a large or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the toad, and it takes 13 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the toad's turns. The toad can have only one target swallowed at a time.
If the crocanura dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The crocanura can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

trait.name: Uncanny Camouflage
entries: The crocanura has advantage on Stealth checks.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The crocanura can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The crocanura has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The sky whale can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The sky whale can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the sky whale can't bite another target.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The sky whale makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the toad, and it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the sky whale's turns. Thesky whale can have only one target swallowed at a time.
If the sky whale dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail Swing
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is large or smaller it must make a {@dc 15} strenght saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mantis makes two melee attacks or one acid glob attack

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the mantis can't bite another target.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The mantis makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the slug, and it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the slug's turns.

If the mantis takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the slug must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the slug. If the slug dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Grabbing Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target.{@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the mantis can't use its grabbing claws or flicking claws on another target.

action.name: Flicking Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet and is knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Acid Glob Spit {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, breaking itself free on a succesfull save.
Appearance

Spore Mantises resemble stick-insects, albeit many times larger and encased within bark-like armor. They have six legs that are also encased in bark, and small heads which can retract into their log-like armor. Notably, they have two fang-like mandibles used for crushing bone.
Roar
The roars of Spore Mantises are insect-like and very high pitched despite their size.
Personality

Spore Mantises remain camouflaged until their prey is within the right distance to attack. They can also be very aggressive when startled. Like most of Skull Island's fauna, they appear to fear the Skullcrawlers, and will flee at first sight of the reptilian monsters.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spore mantis can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the spore mantis remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree trunk.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The spore mantis's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Marauder is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 22}, {@hit 18} to hit with spell attacks). The Marauder has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Marauder has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The Marauder's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Teleport
entries: With a bonus action the Marauder magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

trait.name: Preparation
entries: When preparing her spells, the Marauder can swap out any spell on her list of prepared spells for another wizard spell of the same level.

trait.name: If it can be learned, I know
entries: The Marauder can access the Tower Arcane's knowledge.
She can spend a minute attuning to the tower in search of any piece of knowledge that has been collected and secured in the Tower by the Yuguloths.

trait.name: Greater Contigency
entries: When The Marauder casts a {@spell contingency} spell, she can choose a spell of any level, instead of up to 5th as her contingency.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage. The target must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Cast Spell
entries: The Marauder casts a spell.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The Marauder uses teleport

action.name: Viscous Spit
entries: The Beast spits a glob of viscous material at a creature within 90 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained} for 1 hour.
A creature can use its action to repeat the save.

action.name: Cleansing Fire {@recharge 5}
entries: The Beast exhales silvery fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) radiant damage and any spell of 3rd level or lower affecting it is dispelled. On a successful one it takes half as much damage.

action.name: Vanish
entries: The Beast becomes {@condition invisible} until it attacks a creature.

action.name: Lethargic Poison
entries: The Beast exhales a lethargic gas in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 10 minutes. If the target fails the save by 5 or more it also falls {@condition unconscious}.
The creature wakes up if it suffers any damage or if someone uses an action to wake it.

action.name: Water Blast
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be pushed back 30 feet if its large or smaller, or 15 feet if its huge.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18})

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The Beats makes one bite attack against a medium or smaller that is {@condition restrained}. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the Beast, and it takes 28 {@damage 8d6} acid damage at the start of each of the Beasts' turns.

bonus.name: Adapt (2 uses)
entries: The Beast gains resistance to all types of damage it suffered last round. It also gains one of the its adapting Traits.

trait.name: Sickening Light
entries: The beast sheds light bright in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. When a creature starts its turn within the bright light it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}. A creature recovers one level of {@condition exhaustion} caused by this feature each time it starts its turn outside the area of effect.

trait.name: Smoking Body
entries: The beast begins expelling smoke (30 feet radius each round). It can spend its actions or legendary actions to emit an additional 30 feet sphere of smoke (or increase the area of an already existing smoke cloud by 30 feet (radius).

trait.name: Long Tongue
entries: Grants Tongue Attack.

trait.name: Multiattack
entries: The beast makes two attacks.

legendary.name: Attack (2)
entries: The Beast uses one of its actions.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Beast moves up to its speed.

trait.name: Fel Armor
entries: The herald takes no damage from the first attack against it each round and ignores any nondamaging effects of the attack.

trait.name: Grant Blood Rage
entries: As a bonus action, the herald can grant a single living creature blood rage, giving it advantage on attacks for 3 rounds. At the end of this time, the target gains 1 level of {@condition exhaustion} and suffers 13 ({@damage 2d12}) necrotic damage from blood loss.

action.name: Engulfing Fel Blood
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) slashing damage and the target must make a successful {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw become Engulfed by fel flames. While engulfed the creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage at the start of each of the herald's turns. A creature can spend its action to put out the fire on itself or an ally within 5 feet.

action.name: Hurl Fel Flame
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120/120 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Herald makes two Hurl Fel Flames attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The herald moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Engulfing Fel Blood (2 Actions)
entries: The herald uses Engulfing Fel Blood.

legendary.name: Hurl Fel Flame
entries: The Herald uses Hurl Fel Flame.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kenku is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The kenku has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Otherworldly Perception
entries: The kenku can sense the presence of any creature within 30 feet of it that is {@condition invisible} or on the Ethereal Plane. It can pinpoint such a creature that is moving.

trait.name: Soul-touching
entries: The kenku's non harmfull spells have a minimum range of 30 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kenku makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Scepter
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) force damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Light Sensitivity
entries: While in bright light, the storm crow has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Night Terror (1/Turn)
entries: As a bonus action immediately after making a successful melee attack, a malphas storm crow can cast magic missile through his or her sword at the same target.

trait.name: Swordtrained
entries: Malphas are trained from youth in combat. They are proficient with all martial melee and ranged weapons.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The malphas makes three longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Shadow Call
entries: A malphas can cast magic missile as a reaction when it is hit by a ranged weapon attack.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The storm crow's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

entries: {@i Keen eyed and dangerous, a malphas is a winged fey warrior, dressed in finery. Her longsword often sport an ornate pommel or a rich scabbard. Among the fey, they are often referred as storm crows, meaning bearers of bad news.}

entries.name: Sworn to the Shadow Fey
entries: Raised with a sword in their hands, the malphas are fierce warriors who serve the aristocracy of the shadow fey unswervingly.

entries.name: Messengers
entries: Laconic in speech, they nevertheless serve as envoys and messengers from time to time, though as much or more is communicated by the choice in messenger as in the message itself.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The heggarna  can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the heggarna has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Tiger Sneak
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the heggarna has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide. It can use this trait only while it is disguised as a tiger.

trait.name: Psychic Recharge
entries: When the heggarna takes psychic damage it recharges its Nightmare Rift feature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The heggarna can use its Nightmare Rift and make three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Nightmare Rift {@recharge 5}
entries: The heggarna targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see or hear the heggarna, the target must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target becomes {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Illusory Appearance
entries: The heggarna covers itself with a magical illusion that makes it look like a Tiger. The illusion ends if the heggarna takes a bonus action to end it or if the heggarna dies. The illusion ends immediately if the heggarna attacks or takes damage, but it doesn't end when the heggarna uses Feeding on Fear or Frightful Presence.

The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the heggarna could appear to have fur, but someone touching it would feel its slippery flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern the heggarna is disguised.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the heggarna's choice that is within 120 feet of the heggarna and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the heggarna's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.
The foul abomination wriggles about on multiple caterpillar-like claspers. It has the jagged, circular maw and slippery body of an oversized leech and the head and coloration of a fierce tiger.

entries.name: Night Terrors
entries: Many sleepers have experienced nightmares in which a shadowy creature was sitting on them, draining them of their vital essence. While most of these experiences are because of some underlying psychological trauma, some are the result of visitations by terrifying creatures of the night. One such creature is the heggarna, a vile aberration that feeds on a creature's mental energy as it sleeps and infuses the victim's subconscious with terrible nightmares for its own vile amusement.

entries.name: Hidden Fear
entries: During the day, the heggarna disguises itself as a stray cat, lurking near the homes of potential prey and fleeing with feline-like caution when anyone comes near. Most humanoids overlook simple animals like cats when dealing with a heggarna infestation, but magic can detect the creature's true appearance. Normal animals react to the heggarna with a strange ferocity, which experienced hunters recognize as a sign of a heggarna.

bonus.name: Feeding on Fear
entries: As a bonus action, the heggarna can drain feed on its prey's fear. Each creature within 30 feet of the heggarna that is {@condition frightened} takes {@damage 1d8} psychic damage. The heggarna gains temporary hitpoints equals to the total damage caused.

If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it becomes stable and {@condition unconscious} for {@dice 1d4} hours. While {@condition unconscious} the creature has horrific nightmares and can only be awakened by effects that can suppress fear.

trait.name: Dead Eye (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the deadeye can add {@dice 1d10} to its next attack roll with a ranged weapon.
A creature hit by this attack always receive a fatal wound.

trait.name: Fatal Wound
entries: Whenever deadeye hits a creature, that is not a construct or undead, with a ranged weapon attack, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or receive a fatal wound.
At the start of each of the targets turns it takes {@damage 1d10} piercing damage for each fatal wound it has.
Any creature can take an action to stanch the wounds with a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom (Medicine) check or using a healer's kit. The wounds also closes if the target receives magical healing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deadeye makes two attacks with its longbow.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Corrupting Touch
entries: A herald of darkness can destroy any wooden, leather, copper, iron, stone, or paper object by touching it as a bonus action. A mundane item is destroyed automatically; a magical item survives if its owner makes a successful {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw.

trait.name: Gift of Darkness
entries: A herald of darkness can transform any fey, human, or goblin into one of the shadow fey, if the target willingly accepts this transformation.

trait.name: Umbral Form
entries: As a bonus action the herald of darkness can transform into a shadowy form. In this form, it can enter and occupy spaces occupied by other creatures. Additionally it gains immunity to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage caused by nonmagical attacks and has resistance to all damage except radiant.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The herald of darkness can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The herald of darkness uses Majesty of Darkness, if it is available, and makes one melee attack.

action.name: Embrace Darkness
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., all creatures in reach. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d12}) necrotic damage and targets are {@condition paralyzed} until the start of the herald's next turn. Making a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw negates the paralysis.

action.name: Majesty of Darkness {@recharge 4}
entries: The herald of darkness emits a sinister burst of infernal power. All creatures within 30 feet and in direct line of sight of the herald must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 26 ({@damage 4d12}) necrotic damage and becoming {@condition blinded} for 1 minute on a failed save, or  half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Shadow Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) slashing damage.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Sidero's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). Sidero can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the Sidero's darkvision.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Sidero has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Exploitation of the Debtors
entries: As a bonus action, Sidero targets a creature {@condition charmed} by him within 30 feet. Sidero deals 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage to the target, and Sidero gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Sidero uses Poison Mind. It also makes two attacks: one with its whip and one with its Disruptive Touch.

action.name: Caliper
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) piercing damage plus 33 ({@damage 6d10}) force damage.

action.name: Disruptive Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}44 ({@damage 8d10}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Poison Mind
entries: Sidero targets one or two creatures that he can see within 60 feet of him. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or take 26 ({@damage 4d12}) necrotic damage and is {@condition blinded} until the start of Sidero's next turn.

action.name: Forgetfulness {@recharge}
entries: Sidero targets one creature  he can see within 60 feet of it. That creature must make a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw and on a failure the target is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A {@condition stunned} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target remains {@condition stunned} for the full minute, it forgets everything it sensed, experienced, and learned during the last 5 hours.

reaction.name: Instinctive Charm
entries: When a creature within 60 feet of the Sidero makes an attack roll against him, and another creature is within the attack's range, the attacker must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker must target the creature that is closest to him, not including the Sidero or itself. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target. If the saving throw is successful, the attacker is immune to Sidero's Instinctive Charm for 24 hours.

reaction.name: Overdue
entries: When Sidero fails a saving throw against a spell or effect magic effect it can transfer any harm or effect caused by it to a creature {@condition charmed} by him within 120 feet. The creature is freed from its debt and is no longer {@condition charmed}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Erisbeth is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, +10 to hit with spell attacks). Erisbeth has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Eldritch Strike
entries: When Erisbeth hits a creature with a weapon attack, the creature has disadvantage on its next spell save until the end of the Erisbeth's next turn.

trait.name: Umbral Mask
entries: As a bonus action, Erisbeth can mask her pale flesh and appear to be a living human. This magical illusion lasts until she ends it as a bonus action. The effect also ends if Erisbeth drops to below 1/2 hit points or fewer, or if dispel magic is cast on her. This feature also protects her from taking damage due to her Sunlight Hypersensitivity.

trait.name: Arms Bond
entries: Erisbeth has a bond with ger weapons, shield and armor and can't be disarmed unless she is {@condition incapacitated}.
As a bonus action Erisbeth can materialize and wear her armor, shield and weapon.

trait.name: Arcane Action Surge (2 uses recharges with a short or long rest)
entries: Erisbeth can push herself beyond her normal limits for a moment. On your turn, she can take one additional action.
Additionally when she uses this feature she can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space she can see. She can teleport before or after she takes the additional action.

trait.name: Indomitable  (3 uses recharges with a short or long rest)
entries: Erisbeth can reroll a saving throw she fails, keeping the second roll.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Erisbeth regains 10 hit points at the start of her turn if she has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If Erisbeth takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of Erisbeth's next turn.

trait.name: Vampire Weakness (Vampire)
entries: Erisbeth has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance}. Erisbeth can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
{@i Harmed by Running Water}. Erisbeth takes 20 acid damage if she ends her turn in running water.

{@i Stake to the Heart}. If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into Erisbeth's heart while Erisbeth is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, Erisbeth is {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity}. Erisbeth takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Erisbeth can make three attacks or cast two cantrips.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or 17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, Erisbeth can grapple the target (escape {@dc 19}).

action.name: Bite (once per turn)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by Erisbeth, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage, 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and Erisbeth regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

reaction.name: War Caster
entries: When Erisbeth uses her reaction to make an opportunity attack against a target, she can cast a spell on it instead. The spell must have a casting time of  1 action and must target only that creature.

monster.name: Training Dummy
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

reaction.name: Take it!
entries: The training dummy can take it, and won't complain about a thing.

trait.name: Good Listener
entries: The training dummy wants to hear all about it. You can complain to your hearts content, it will listen to everything and won't interrupt you a single time.

action.name: Assert Dominance
entries: The training dummy will strike a T-Pose when nobody is looking. Otherwise it will hide its arms to make everybody around feel safer.
